box title: 壁面装飾 練込群魚 {Hekimen sōshoku nerikomi gungyo} (Marbleized wall decoration with a school of fish); signed: 五郎造 {Gorō zō} (Made by Gorō), with seal: 五 {Go}
medium: Clear glazed stoneware mounted to black lacquer board
signed: painted in red at BR of lacquer board: Kawamoto / 63
text: Kawamoto Gorō was one of the most innovative ceramic artists in Japan in the post-World War II period. Born to a family of potters who produced wares traditionally made in the Seto region, he abandoned the well-known styles in the 1950s to produce unconventional and radical pieces and it is these hand-built forms that set him apart from others. This wall ornament of fish is an impressive example of Kawamoto’s masterful command of abstraction.
title: Marbleized wall decoration with a school of fish
